intro: Ixora candolleana, commonly known as the flame of the forest, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its bright orange-red inflorescences that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth surface with a slightly waxy texture. The flowers are fragrant and attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
